questions.question: Five volts is applied to two 2 ohm resistors in series. The resulting current is

explanations.a: Too high; would require only 1 ohm total resistance.
explanations.c: Correct. Total resistance = 4Ω; I = V/R = 5/4 = 1.25 A.
explanations.d: Incorrect; enough info is provided to calculate current.

questions.question: Five volts is applied to two 2 ohm resistors connected in parallel. The resulting current is

explanations.a: Correct. Parallel resistance = 1Ω; I = V/R = 5/1 = 5 A.
explanations.c: Incorrect; this is for series connection.

questions.question: Six volts is applied to a 2 ohm resistor in series with two 2 ohm resistors connected in parallel. The current through the first resistor is

explanations.b: Correct. Parallel of two 2Ω = 1Ω. Total resistance = 2 + 1 = 3Ω. I = 6V/3Ω = 2 A.
explanations.d: Too low; incorrect Ohm’s law usage.
